img.alt: Free Meal Program in Response to COVID-19
Free Meal Program in Response to COVID-19

a.title: SCCSD Free Meal Program for Children Ages 1-18: Open Sites in Response to COVID-19 School Closure

h2.a: SCCSD Free Meal Program for Children Ages 1-18: Open Sites in Response to COVID-19 School Closure

div.div: The Sioux City Community School District is participating in the Emergency COVID 19 Food Service Program to feed the youth in our community while schools are closed due to the pandemic. Beginning Wednesday, March 18, 2020, meals are available Monday –Friday at over 20 locations. Each site serves for 30 minutes once a day; see the schedule below for more details.

h2.span: Morningside Elementarty – No School for Kindergarten ONLY Due to Kindergarten Registration

article.class: post-298900 page_section type-page_section status-publish hentry first
post-5436 page_section type-page_section status-publish hentry first

p.span: The Sioux City Community School District exists to educate students to believe in their talents and skills, achieve academic excellence, and succeed in reaching their potential.

We offer a strong academic program of studies that focus on improving student learning and achievement. By blending a solid-core curriculum and caring staff, our schools provide students with excellent opportunities for learning and growth.

article.class: post-298906 page_section type-page_section status-publish hentry first

div.div: Staff Hold a Master's Degree or Higher

div.p: Teaching nearly 15,000 students to believe, achieve, and succeed.
This week, the KCAU "Classroom 9" team covered a lesson on how wind is created. Visit: https://bit.ly/2VWWnhv to watch the lesson!

To help students access online learning materials, the SCCSD has set-up mobile hotspots for students to access free Wi-Fi throughout the community. Students can now access Wi-Fi from mobile units Mon-Fri at six new sites. View the sites here: https://bit.ly/2KvjLwV

div.div:
Educational Service Center
627 4th Street
Sioux City, IA 51101
Phone: 712-279-6667
